intro: Moquilea maranhensis, commonly known as the Maranhão moquilea, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
